column4: This is the Sefer Toldot
Avraham, Yitzchak, Ya'akov, Yehudah and his brothers;
then,through Yehudah, Peretz and Zerach by Tamar; then Chetzron, Ram;
then Amminadav, Nachshon, Salmon;
then Bo`az by Rachav
then Yishai fathered Dovid HaMelech. FROM DOVID HAMELECH TO THE TIME OF THE GOLUS
then Rechav'am
then Yehoshafat, Yoram, Uziyahu
then Yotam, Achaz
then M'nasheh
then Y'khanyahu
After Y'khanyahu, then Sh'altiel, then Z'rubavel
then Av'ichud, then Elyakim, then Azur;
then Tzadok, then Yakhin, then El'ichud;
then El'azar, then Mattan, then Ya'akov.
Ya'akov fathered Yosef, the ba'al
So then, there were arba'a asar
The huledet
Her shidduch, Yosef, being a tzaddik and not wanting to humiliate her publicly, planned to deal with the get
Now just when Yosef had thought through to this tachlis
And she shall bear BEN
Now all this occurred so that which was spoken by Hashem through the Navi
HINEI, HA'ALMAH HARAH V'YOLEDET BEN V'KARAT SHMO IMMANU-EL
Then Yosef, rising up from sleep, did as the malach Hashem commanded him and he took his wife.
And he did not know her until she bore BEN
Now after Yehoshua was born in Beit-Lechem Yehudah, in the days of Herod [the Great, the Roman client] king --hinei!-- chachamim
saying, Where is he that is born Melech HaYehudim? For we have seen his KOCHAV
Because Herod the king heard this, he was terribly shaken, and all Yerushalayim with him.
And assemblying all the Rashei Hakohanim
They told him, In Beit-Lechem Yehudah; because so it stands written by the Navi:
`And YOU, BEIT-LECHEM,
Then Herod secretly summoned the chachamim and ascertained from them the exact date of the manifestation of the KOCHAV.
Then he sent them to Beth-Lechem, saying, Go and make a thorough search for the yeled
After they heard the king, they departed, and--hinei!--the KOCHAV they had seen in the Mizrach
When they saw the KOCHAV, they rejoiced with exceedingly great nachas
And, entering the bais
And having been warned in a cholom
And when they'd gone, hinei, a malach Hashem appeared to Yosef Ben Dovid in a cholom
So, having got up, he took the yeled, and his Em by night and departed for Mitzrayim
And he was there until the death of Herod.  This was to fulfill what had been spoken by Hashem through the Navi, UMIMITZRAYIM KARATI LIVNI

When Herod saw that he had been outwitted by the chachamim, he was greatly enraged, and he ordered the slaughter of all the yeladim in Beit-Lechem and its vicinity who were two years old or under, in accordance with the time that he had learned from the chachamim.
Then came the fulfillment of what was spoken through Yirmeyah HaNavi:
KOL B'RAMAH NISHMAH
When Herod died--hinei!--in Mitzrayim
saying, Arise, and take the yeled and his Em and go to Eretz-Yisroel, for those seeking the life of the yeled are dead.
And Yosef arose and took the yeled and his Em, and entered Eretz-Yisroel.
And when Yosef heard that Archelaus had succeeded his father Herod as king of Yehudah, Yosef was afraid to go there.  And, having been warned in a cholom, he departed into the districts of the Galil.
And Yosef made his home in the shtetl
Now in those days Yochanan of the tevilah of teshuva appears, preaching, crying out as a maggid
saying, Make teshuva, for the Malchut HaShomayim has come near.
For this is the one spoken of through Yeshayah the Navi, saying, KOL KOREY BAMIDBAR
Now Yochanan himself had camel-hair clothing and a leather belt around his waist, and his food was arbe
Then all Yerushalayim and all Yehudah and the whole region of the Yarden were going out to him.
Making vidduy
But when he saw many of the Perushim and Tzedukim coming to where he was using the Yarden as a mikveh mayim, he said to them, You yeladim of nachashim
Produce p'ri tov l'teshuva
Do not presume to say to yourselves, `We have the yichus
And already the ax is laid at the shoresh haAitzim
I give you a tevilah
The winnowing fork is in his hand, and he will clear out his threshing floor, and he will gather his wheat into the barn; but the chaff he will burn with unquenchable aish
Then Yehoshua comes from the Galil to the Yarden to Yochanan, to submit to Yochanan's tevilah
But Yochanan would have deterred him, saying, I have need to submit to your tevilah
But answering him, Yehoshua said, Permit it now, for thus it is proper to fulfill all Tzidkat Hashem [DANIEL 9:24].

And having received the tevilah in the Yarden's mikveh mayim, Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach immediately came up.  And--hinei!--the Shomayim were opened to him, and he saw the Ruach Hashem descending like a yonah
And, hinei, a bat kol
Then Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach was led up into the midbar by the Ruach Hakodesh of Hashem to undergo temptation by Hasatan.
And, having undergone a tzom
And the tempter came to him and said to him, If you are the Ben HaElohim, then speak the command that these avanim
But Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach answered, Katuv
Then Hasatan takes Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach to the Ir Hakodesh
and says to Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach, If you are the Ben HaElohim, then throw yourself down, for katuv
Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach said to Hasatan, Again, it is written, LO TENASSU ES HASHEM ELOHEICHEM
Again, Hasatan takes Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach to a very high mountain and shows him all the mamlechot
And Hasatan said to Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach, All these things I will give to you, if you will fall down V'TISHTACHAVEH
Then Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach says to him, Depart, Hasatan!  For katuv

Then Hasatan leaves him, and, hinei, malachim came and attended to Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach. MOSHIACH'S KEHILLAH BEGINS TO FORM IN THE GALIL, WITH ITS ROSH HAEDAT AND MANHIG, REBBE MELECH  HAMOSHIACH, SURROUNDED BY MOSHIACH'S SHLUCHIM AS ACHIM
Now, having heard that Yochanan was arrested, Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach departed into the Galil.
And having left behind Natzeret, Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach headquartered in K'far-Nachum by the sea, in the environs of Z'vulun and Naftali.
This was to fulfill what was spoken through Yeshayah HaNavi,
ARTZAH Z'VULUN V'ARTZAH NAFTALI
the people sitting in CHOSHECH R'U OHR GADOL
From then Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach, as a maggid, began to proclaim, saying, Make teshuva, for the Malchut HaShomayim has come near.
And walking beside Lake Kinneret,
And Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach says, Come, follow me, and I will make you daiyagei adam
And immediately, leaving their nets, they followed Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach.
And having gone on from there, he saw two other achim, Ya`akov Ben-Zavdai and Yochanan his brother, in the sirah
Immediately, leaving the sirah
And Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach went about in all the Galil, exercising the ministry of moreh
And the report went out about Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach throughout all Syria; and they brought to him all the cholim
And from the Galil, the Decapolis, Yerushalayim, Yehudah, and Ever-haYarden--from all these places great multitudes followed Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach.
When Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach saw the multitudes, he ALAH HAHAR
Then Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach began to speak, and gave them this torah
Ashrey ANIYEY RUACH
Ashrey are the AVELIM
Ashrey are the ANAVIM (humble, YESHAYAH 29:19; TZEFANYAH
Ashrey are the ones hungering and thirsting for Tzidkat Hashem
Ashrey are the merciful, for they will be shown rachamim
Ashrey are those of LEV TAHOR
Ashrey are the peace makers, for they will be called bnei haElohim
Ashrey are the ones being persecuted because of Tzidkat Hashem
Ashrey are you when they reproach you and persecute you and speak all kinds of lashon horah against you, speaking sheker
Have simcha
You are the melach ha'aretz
You are the Ohr HaOlam
No one, after lighting a menorah, places it under a measuring basket, but on the shulchan, and it gives light to kol anshey habais
In like manner, let your light shine before bnei Adam, so that they may see your ma'asim tovim
Do not think that I came to abolish the Torah or the Nevi'im.  I did not come to abolish but to complete.
For, omein, truly I say to you, until Shomayim and ha'aretz pass away, not one yod, not one tag
Therefore, whoever annuls one of the least of these mitzvot
For I say unto you that unless your Tzidkat Hashem
You have heard that it was said to the ancients, LO TIRTZACH
But I say to you, that everyone who harbors ka'as
Therefore, if you bring your korban to the Mitzbe'ach
leave your korban there before the Mitzbe'ach, and go and first be reconciled to your ach b'Moshiach, and then come offer your korban.
Come to terms quickly with your ish riv
For, omein, truly I say to you, you may never come out from there until you repay the last peruta
You have heard that it was said, LO TINAF
But I say to you that everyone looking upon a woman with ta'avah
And if your right eye causes you to commit chet

And if your right hand causes you to commit chet, cut it off and throw it from you, for it is better for you that one of your evarim be lost and not that your whole basar may go into Gehinnom.  REBBE, MELECH HAMOSHIACH'S TORAH ABOUT THE GET
It was also said, `Whoever divorces his wife, let him give to her a GET, a SEFER KERITUT
But I say to you that everyone divorcing his wife, except for the dvar
Again, you have heard that it was said to the ancients, `You shall not break your nederim
But I say to you, Do not swear shevuot
nor by ha'aretz, for it is the foot stool of his feet, nor by Yerushalayim, for it is the kiryat melech rav
Neither are you to swear by your rosh, for you are not able to make one hair turn white or black.
But let your word be `ken, ken`
You have heard that it was said, AYIN TACHAT AYIN, SHEN TACHAT SHEN
But I say to you, Do not set yourself against the rasha
And the one wishing to sue you and take your tunic, give to him also your kaftan.
And whoever will force you to go one mile, go with him two.
And the one asking you to give and the one wishing to borrow from you, from these do not turn away.   REBBE, MELECH HAMOSHIACH TEACHES AHAVAH/AGAPE FOR OYEVIM
You have heard that it was said, V'AHAVTAH L'REI'ACHAH
But I say to you, Love your enemies, and offer tefillos
Do this so that you may become banim of your Av sh'baShomayim, for his shemesh
For if you have ahavah
And if you give shalom greetings only to your achim, what extraordinary thing are you doing? Don't even the Goyim do the same?
Therefore, be shlemim
Be careful that you don't practice your tzedakah before bnei Adam in order to varf
Therefore, whenever you contribute tzedakah, don't blow the shofar before you, as the tzevu'im
But when you contribute tzedakah, do not let your left hand know what your right hand is doing,
so that your tzedakah may be in secret, and your Av haRo'eh b'seter
And whenever you daven, do not be as the tzevu'im
But you, whenever you daven, enter into the secret place, your secret cheder,*  and, having shut your door, offer tefillos to your Av Asher b'Seter
But when you daven, do not babble on and on maarich
Therefore, be nisht azoi
Therefore, when you offer tefillos, daven like this:                   THE MOSHIACH'S TEFILLAH            `Avinu sh'baShomayim`
`Tavo malchutechah`
`Es lechem chukeinu ten lanu hayom`
`u-s'lach lanu es chovoteinu ka'asher salachnu`
`V'al t'vieinu lidey nisayon`
For if you give men mechila
But if you do not give men mechila
And whenever you undergo a tzom
But when you undergo a tzom, anoint your rosh with shimmen
so that your tzom is concealed from bnei Adam but not from your Av Asher b'Seter
Do not store up for yourselves otzarot
But avekshtel
For where your otzar
The eye is the menorah of the basar.  Therefore, if your eye is unblurred, then your whole basar will be lighted.
But if yours is the 'ayin horo
No one is able to serve two adonim
Therefore, I say to you, Do not have a LEV ROGEZ
Look to the OF HASHOMAYIM
And who among you by a LEV ROGEZ
And why have a LEV ROGEZ
But I say to you that not even Sh'lomo in all his kavod was clothed as one of these.
And if Hashem thus clothes the grass of the field that exists today and tomorrow is thrown into an oven,  how much more will he clothe you, you ones of little emunah.
Therefore,do not have a LEV ROGEZ
For all these things the Goyim strive for. For your Av sh'baShomayim bavorn
But seek first the Malchut Hashem and his Tzidkat Hashem, and all these things will be added to you.
Therefore, do not have a LEV ROGEZ
Judge not lest you be judged.
For with what judgment you judge, you will be judged, and with what measure you measure, it will be measured to you.
And why do you see the speck in the eye of your brother, but you do not consider the beam in your own eye.
Or how will you say to your brother, let me take the speck out from your eye, and--hinei!--the beam is in your own eye.
Tzevu'a
Do not give the kodesh
Keep asking and it shall be given to you; keep searching and you shall find; keep knocking and the delet
For everyone asking receives, and the one searching finds, and to the one knocking the delet will be opened.
Or what man is there among you the ben of whom will ask for lechem
Or if he asks for a dag
Therefore, if you, being ra'im
Therefore, everything that you wish bnei Adam do for you, thus also you do for them. For this is the Torah and the Nevi'im. WITHOUT KEDUSHAH NO MAN WILL SEE HASHEM
Enter through the derech
But tzar
Beware of the nevi'ei hasheker
By their perot
So every aitz tov
An aitz tov is not able to produce p'ri rah nor is an aitz nishchat able to produce p'ri tov.
Kol aitz
Therefore, by their perot
Not all the ones saying to me, `Adoneinu, Adoneinu,` will enter the Malchut HaShomayim, but the one doing ratson Avi sh'baShomayim
Many will say to me [Moshiach] on that Day [the Yom HaDin, the Day of Judgment], `Adoneinu, Adoneinu, did we not speak as nevi'im in your Name?  Did we not cast out shedim
And then I will tell them to their face, `I never knew you. Depart from me, you workers of mufkarut
Therefore, everyone who hears these words of mine and does them, is like a chacham
And the geshem
And everyone hearing these words of mine [Divrei Moshiach] and not doing them is like the shoteh
And the geshem
And it came about when Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach finished these divrei torah
For his ministry of moreh
And when Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach came down from the mountain, many multitudes followed him.
And--hinei--an ish metzorah
And, having stretched out his hand, Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach touched him, saying, I am willing. Be made tahor.
And Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach says to him, See that you tell no one, but go and show yourself to the kohen and offer the korban about which Moshe gave mitzva as an edut
Now when Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach entered into K'far-Nachum, a centurion approached him, begging him
and saying, Adoneinu, my servant has been bedridden in the house, paralyzed, in terrible tza'ar
And Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach says to him, I am coming.  I will give him refu'ah
The centurion answered, Adoneinu, * I am not worthy that you might come under my roof, but only say the dvar, and my servant will receive the refu'ah
For I also am a man under marut
And having heard this, Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach was amazed and said to those who followed him, Omein, I say to you, in no one in Yisroel have I found such great emunah.
And I say to you, that many from the mizrach
But the Bnei HaMalchut will be thrown out into the outer choshech
And Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach said to the centurion, Go!  According to your bittachon
When Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach entered the bais
Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach touched her hand, and the fever left her.  She then began functioning as his mesharetet
And when erev
Thus was fulfilled what was spoken by Yeshayah the Navi, saying,  ACHEN CHOLAYEINU HU NASAH UMACHOVEINU S'VALAM

And when Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach saw the crowd around him, he gave orders to go over to the other side. IN THE OLAM HAZEH, THE REBBE, MELECH HAMOSHIACH OF YISROEL REQUIRES TOTAL ALLEGIANCE, WITHOUT WHICH ONE CANNOT BE MEKABEL MOSHIACH
A sofer
And Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach says to him, Foxes have holes and the OF HASHOMAYIM
And another of Moshiach's talmidim said to him, Adoneinu, allow me first to go and bury my father.
But Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach says to him, Follow me, and permit the mesim
And when he embarked into the sirah
And--hinei!--a great storm came up on the lake, so that the sirah
And Moshiach's talmidim approached and aroused him, saying, Adoneinu, hoshieynu!  We are perishing!

And Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach says to them, Why are you fearful, you ones of little emunah? REBBE, MELECH HAMOSHIACH SHOWS HIMSELF ADON KOL HA'ARETZ Then, arising, Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach rebuked the winds and the sea, and there was great calm.
And the men were astonished, saying, What sort of man is this!?  That even the winds and the sea obey him! REBBE, MELECH HAMOSHIACH CASTS OUT THE SHEDIM
And when Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach came to the other side of the lake, in the land of the people of Gadara, he was met by two men possessed by shedim
And--hinei--they screamed, saying, Mah lanu valach, Ben HaElohim?
Now there was feeding far away from them a large herd of chazirim
And the shedim begged Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach, saying,If you cast us out, send us into the herd of chazirim.

And Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach said to them, Go away!  So the shedim, coming out, went away into the chazirim. And--hinei!--all the herd of chazirim rushed down the bank into the lake, and they perished in the water.
And the herdsmen of the chazirim fled, and, having gone away into the town, they told the whole story of what had happened to the men possessed by shedim.
And--hinei!--the whole town came out to meet Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach, and seeing him, they begged him to depart from their area.
And, having embarked into a sirah
And--hinei!--they brought to Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach a paralytic lying upon a mat.  Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach, having seen their emunah, said to the paralytic, Chazak!
And--hinei!--some of the Sofrim said to themselves, This one commits Chillul Hashem! [VAYIKRA 22:32]
And Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach, reading their minds, said, Why are you thinking ra'ah
For which is easier to say, `Selicha is granted on your averos!` or`Arise and walk!`?
But in order that you may know that the Ben HaAdam [Moshiach, Daniel 7:13-14] has samchut *
And arising, he went away to his bais.
And having witnessed this, the multitudes experienced yirat Shomayim and gave kavod to Hashem, who had given such samchut to men.  THE KERI'AH

And going away from there, Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach saw a man called Mattityahu sitting in the tax office.   And Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach says to him, Follow me. And Mattityahu arose and followed him.
And it came about that while Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach was sitting bimesibba
When the Perushim saw this, they were saying to Moshiach's talmidim, Why does your Rebbe eat with the mochesim and the chote'im?
But when Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach heard this, he said, It is not the bari'im
Go and learn what this means: CHESED CHAFATZTI V'LO ZEVACH
Then Yochanan's talmidim approached Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach, saying, Why do we and the Perushim often undergo tzomot
And Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach said to them, Surely the Bnei haChuppah
No one sews a patch of unshrunk cloth on an old garment, for the patch pulls away from the garment, and a worse tear results.
Neither do men put yayin chadash
While Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach was speaking these things to them--hinei--one of the nichbadim
And Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach arose and, with his talmidim, followed him.
And--hinei!--an isha
For she was saying to herself, If only I might touch his garment, I will receive refu'ah
Turning and seeing her, Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach said, Chazak, bat
And having come into the bais
Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach was saying, Go away! For the yaldah
But when the crowd had been put outside, Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach went in and took the yaldah by the hand and the yaldah was made to stand up alive.
And this shema
And as Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach went on from there, two iverim
And when Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach entered the bais
Then Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach touched their eyes, saying, According to your emunah, let it be done for you.
And their eyes were opened. Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach sternly warned them, saying, See to it that no one knows!
But having gone out, they made Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach known in that entire district.
After they had departed, the people brought to Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach a mute man who was possessed by shedim.
And when the shedim had been cast out by Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach, the mute man spoke.  And the multitudes marveled, saying,  Never was anything like this seen in eretz-Yisroel!
But the Perushim said, It was by the Sar HaShedim
And Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach went about all the towns and villages exercising the ministry of moreh
And looking out on the multitudes, Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach felt rachamanut
Then Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach says to his talmidim, The katzir
Therefore, offer tefillos to the Adon HaKatzir
And summoning his Shneym Asar
Now of the Shneym Asar Shluchim, the names are these: first, Shimon, the one being called Kefa, and Andrew his brother, Ya'akov Ben-Zavdai and Yochanan his brother,
Philippos and Bar-Talmai, T'oma and Mattityahu the moches, Ya'akov Bar-Chalfai and Taddai,
Shimon the Zealot and Yehudah from K'riot, who betrayed Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach. REBBE, MELECH HAMOSHIACH GIVES S'MICHAH COMMISSIONING TO THE SHNEYM ASAR
These Shneym Asar
but go rather to the Seh Oveid HaBeth Yisroel
And, while going, preach that the Malchut HaShomayim is imminent and miyad.
Heal the cholim, raise the mesim
Take neither gold nor silver nor copper for your money-belts,
nor a beggar's sack for the road nor two tunics, nor sandals, nor a staff, for the oseh hamelachah
And into whichever town or shtetl you enter, inquire who in it is a ben chayil
And when you enter into the bais
And if indeed the bais is a bais chayil
And whoever neither receives you nor listens to your divrei [Moshiach], as you are leaving and as you go outside of that bais
Omein, I say to you, it will be more tolerable on Yom HaDin
Hinei!  I send you as kevesim
And beware of bnei Adam, for they will deliver you up to the sanhedriyot
And before moshelim
But when they deliver you up, do not be of a LEV ROGEZ
For you are not the ones speaking, but the Ruach Avichem
And brother will deliver up to death his own brother, even an abba his own yeled.  And yeladim will stand up against their horim
And you will be under the sinas chinam
But when they persecute you in one city, flee to the other; for omein, I say to you, by no means will you complete the arim
A talmid is not above his Rebbe nor an eved
It is enough for the talmid that he be as his Rebbe, and the eved as his Ba'al Bayit. If they called the Ba'al Bayit
Therefore, do not fear them; for nothing has been veiled which will not be unveiled; and nothing has been hidden which will not be made known.
What I say to you in the choshech
And do not fear those who kill the basar
Are not two sparrows sold for the least valuable copper coin?  And yet not one of them will fall to the ground apart from Avichem!
But, as far as you are concerned, even the hairs of your rosh have been numbered.
Therefore, al ta'arotz
Therefore, everyone who shall declare publicly the Ani Ma'amin of me [as Moshiach], before bnei haAdam, I will make hoda'ah
But everyone who makes hakhchashah
Do not think that I have come to bring shalom al ha'aretz
For I came to divide a man against his Av, and a bat against her Em, and a kallah
And the OIYVEI ISH ANSHEI VEITOH
The one who has more ahavah
The one who does not take up his aitz shel hinnazrut

The one who has found his nefesh will lose it; the one who has lost his nefesh for my sake [lema'an Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach] will find it.                                                     REBBE, MELECH HAMOSHIACH AND THE SACHAR FROM HASHEM
The one who gives the kabbalat panim

The one who gives the Baruch Haba to a navi in the name of a navi will receive the sachar of a navi, and the one who gives the Baruch Haba to a tzaddik in the name of a tzaddik will receive the sachar of a tzaddik.

And whoever in the name of a talmid [of Moshiach] gives only a cup of cold water to one of these little ones [the least of the talmidim of Moshiach], omein, I say to you, he will by no means lose his sachar
And it came about when Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach finished giving commands to his Shneym Asar Talmidim, he moved on from there, exercising the ministry of moreh
Now when Yochanan, in the beit hasohor
They asked him, Tell us. Are you Hu HaBa*
And Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach answered them, saying, Go give the shema
the iverim
Ashrey
As they were leaving, Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach began to speak to the multitudes about Yochanan, What did you go out into the midbar
What did you go out to see?  Someone shtats in appearance attired in soft raiment? Hinei, the ones wearing soft raiment are in houses of melachim
But what did you go out to see?  A Navi?  Ken, I tell you. And one greater than a Navi.

The Malchut HaShomayim is like a man, the Ba'al Bayit, who went out early in the boker
And having agreed with the po'alim to salary them a denarius for their day's pay, the Ba'al Bayit sent them into his kerem.

and he said to those, `You go also into the kerem. And whatever is right, this is what your pay will be.'
And they left.  And again, having gone out around the sixth and the ninth hour, the Ba'al Bayit did the same thing.
And around the eleventh hour, having gone out, the Ba'al Bayit found others standing around, and he says to them,  `Why have you been standing here all the day not working?'
The idle workers say to the Ba'al Bayit, `Because no one hired us.` The Ba'al Bayit says to them, `You go also into the kerem.'
And when erev had come, another man, the owner of the kerem, says to his foreman, `Call the po'alim and give to them the wage, beginning with the acharonim and going to the rishonim.'
And the ones that came around the eleventh hour each received a denarius.
And when the rishonim came, they were under the impression that they would receive a larger sum; instead, they themselves each received a denarius.
And when they received the denarius, they were complaining against the Ba'al Bayit,
saying `These acharonim worked one hour, and you made them equal to us, the ones having endured the burden and the heat of the whole day.'
But the Ba'al Bayit said in reply to one of them, `Chaver, I am not cheating you.  Did you not agree that I would pay you the usual day's wage, a denarius?
Take what belongs to you, your denarius, and go.  But it is my ratson, my good pleasure, to give to this one who is last also what I gave to you.
Or is it not allowable for me to do what I wish with the things that are mine? Or do you look with a jealous 'ayin ra'ah upon my goodness?

And Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach says to him, See [that] you say nothing to anyone, but rather go show yourself to the kohen and offer [the korban] for the tohorah of you which Moshe

But the one having gone out began to preach many things and to spread the dvar, so that no longer was Rebbe Melech HaMoshiach able to openly enter into [the] shtetl, but he was outside in desolate places. And they were coming to Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach from every direction.
And having entered again into K'far-Nachum after [many] yamim, it was heard that Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach is at home.
And many were gathered together so that there was no longer any room at the delet, and Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach was speaking the dvar Hashem to them.
And they come carrying to Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach a paralytic being carried along by arba'a anashim.

And not being able to bring [the paralytic] to him on account of the multitude, they removed the roof where Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach was, and having made an opening, they lowered the mat upon which the paralytic was lying.
And Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach, having seen the emunah of them, says to the paralytic, Beni, your averos are granted selicha.
And there were some of the Sofrim
Why is this one speaking thus?  He is guilty of Chillul Hashem gidduf.  Who is able to grant selicha to averos except Hashem?  [Yeshayah 43:25]
And, ofen ort
Which is easier? To say to the paralytic, `Your averos are granted selicha', or to say, `Stand and pick up your mat and walk'?
But in order that you may have da'as that the Ben HaAdam
To you I say, stand, pick up your mat, and go to your bais.
And the man arose, and, ofen ort
And Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach went out again beside the lake; and all the multitude was coming to him, and he was teaching them Torah.
And as he was passing by, he saw Levi Ben Chalfai sitting in the tax office, and Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach says to him, Follow me. And, rising up, Levi
And it came to pass that Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach reclined at tish in Levi's house, and many mochesim
And the Sofrim
And having heard this, Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach says to them, It's not the strong ones that have need of a rofeh

And the talmidim of Yochanan and the Perushim came with tzomot.  And they come and say to Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach, Why [do] the talmidim of the Perushim and the talmidim of Yochanan come with tzomot, but your talmidim do not?
And Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach, said to them, Surely the Bnei HaChuppah of the Chosson
But yamim will come when the Chosson is taken away from them, and then they will undergo tzomot HaYom HaHu.
No one sews a patch of unshrunk cloth on an old garment; otherwise, the patch will pull away from it, the new from the old, and a worse tear results.
And no one puts yayin chadash
And it came about [that] on Shabbos, Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach was passing through the grainfields, and his talmidim began to make [their] way picking the heads of grain. [Devarim 23:25]
And the Perushim said to him, Look, why are they on Shabbatot engaging in what is not mutar
And Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach says to them, Have you never read in the Tanakh what Dovid HaMelech did when he was in need and he was hungry, he and the ones with him?
How he entered into the Beis Hashem during the yamim of Avyator the Kohen Gadol and the Lechem HaPanim he ate, which to be eaten it is not mutar
And Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach said to them, Shabbos was created for the sake of man and not man for the sake of Shabbos. [Shemot 23:12; Devarim 5:14]
Therefore, HaBen HaAdam [Moshiach, Daniel 7:13-14] is Adon even of Shabbos.
And Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach entered again into the shul. And there was there a man having a withered hand.
And they were watching Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach [to see] if on Shabbatot he will heal him, in order that they might accuse him.
And he says to the man, the one with the withered hand, Stand up here in the center.
And he says to them, Is it mutar

And having looked [at] them with ka'as and having agmat nafesh at the stubborn hardness of their levavot, Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach says to the man. Stretch out your hand, And the man stretched it out, and his hand was restored.
And ofen ort
And Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach with his talmidim went away to the lake, and a great multitude from the Galil and also from Yehudah followed Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach.

And from Yerushalayim and from Idumea and from the other side of the Yarden and from around Tzor-Tzidon area, a great multitude [followed], hearing everything that he was doing, and they came to Rebbe Melech HaMoshiach.
And he said to his talmidim that a sirah
For he had brought refu'ah to many, with the result that as many as had afflictions pressed in on him in order to touch him.
And the ruchot hatemei'ot
And Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach sternly rebuked them, lest they should make him known.
And Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach goes up to the mountain and summons those whom he wanted, and they came to him.

And Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach appointed and gave s'michah to Shneym Asar, whom also he designated Shluchim, that they might be with him [have chavurah with him], and that he might send them out as his maggidim to preach,
and to have samchut to cast out shedim.
And Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach appointed the Shneym Asar: Shimon, to whom he gave the name Kefa,
and Ya'akov Ben-Zavdai and Yochanan, Ya'akov's brother. He gave to them the name Bnei-Regesh,
And Andrew and Philippos and Bar-Talmai, and Mattityahu, and T'oma, and Ya'akov Ben-Chalfai, and Taddia, and Shimon the Zealot,
and Yehudah from K'riot, the one who betrayed Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach.  REBBE, MELECH HAMOSHIACH ACCUSED OF CHILLUL HASHEM
And Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach goes home; and again the multitude assembles, with the result that they were not able to have okhel.
And when his own mishpochah heard of this, they went out to constrain him.  For they were saying, He is meshuga.
And the Sofrim
But having called them, Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach was speaking to them in meshalim
And if a malchut is divided against itself, it is not possible for that malchut to stand.
And if a bais is divided against itself, it will not be possible for that bais to stand.
And if Hasatan has risen up against himself and is divided, it is not possible for him to stand, but his end has arrived.

But no one is able, having entered into the house of the strong man to plunder his possessions, unless first, he binds the strong man, and then he will plunder the house of the strong man. [Yeshayah 49:24,25]
Omein, I say to you that everything--the averos and the Chillul Hashem, whatever they may commit--of the bnei Adam will be granted selicha.
But whoever commits Chillul Hashem gidduf against the Ruach Hakodesh, can never have selicha, but is guilty of a chet Olam.
For they were saying, He has a ruach temei'ah. WHO ARE THE TRUE ACHIM OF REBBE, MELECH HAMOSHIACH?
And the Em
And a multitude was sitting around him, and they are saying to him, Hinei! Your Em
And in reply to them, Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach says, Who is the Em
And having looked around at the ones sitting around him, Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach says, Hinei! The Em
For whoever does the ratzon Hashem, this one is my brother and my sister and mother.
And again Rebbe Melech HaMoshiach began to teach Torah beside the lake. And a huge multitude gathered together to him so that he got into a sirah
And Rebbe Melech HaMoshiach was teaching them with many meshalim
Listen.  Hinei! The Sower went out to sow
And it came about that when he went to sow, that some [seeds] fell beside the road. And the birds came and devoured it.
And other [seeds] fell upon the rocky places where it did not have much soil, and ofen ort
And when the shemesh rose, it was scorched and, because it did not have a shoresh
And other seed fell among the thorns, and the thorns grew up and choked them, and it did not yield p'ri.
And other seed fell into the adamah tovah and it was giving p'ri, rising up and growing, thirty, sixty and one hundredfold.
And Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach was saying, He who has ears to hear, let him hear.
And when he was alone, the Shneym Asar were asking him for a hezber
And he was saying to them. To you the raz
in order that `YIRU they may see and not have da'as V'SHIM'U they may hear and not have binah, lest they should turn and they should receive refu'ah and selicha.'
And Rebbe Melech HaMoshiach says to them, Do you not have da'as of the meaning of this mashal? Then how will you have binah of all the meshalim?
The one sowing sows the dvar Hashem.
And these are the ones beside the road where the dvar Hashem is sown.  And when they hear it, ofen ort
And these are the ones sown upon the rocky places: when they hear the dvar, ofen ort
Yet they do not have a shoresh
And others are the ones sown among thorns.  These are the ones having heard the dvar,
And the worries of the Olam Hazeh and the seduction of osher
And these are the ones sown upon adamah tovah: they hear the dvar Hashem and are mekabel dvar Hashem and bear p'ri, thirty, sixty and one hundredfold.

And Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach was saying to them. Surely a menorah is not brought out in order that it may be put under a measuring bucket or under the couch?  Rather, is it not brought out that it may be placed on the shulchan?
For there is not [anything] nistar
If anyone has ears to hear, let him hear.
And Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach was saying to them, Pay attention!  By what measure you measure it will be measured to you, and still more will be added to you.
For whoever has, it will be given to him, and whoever does not have, even what he has will be taken away from him.
And Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach was saying, Thus is the Malchut Hashem: like a man who casts seed upon the soil,
and goes to sleep b'lailah and arises b'yom, and the seed sprouts up and grows in such a way that he does not have da'as of how it does so.
On its own, the soil bears p'ri: first the blade, then a head of grain, then full wheat in the head.
But when the crop is ripe, ofen ort
And Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach was saying, To what should we compare the Malchut Hashem or by what mashal may we present it?
The Malchut Hashem is like a mustard seed, which, when it is sown on the soil, is smaller [than] all the seeds on the earth.
And when it is sown, it grows up and becomes greater [than] all the plants of the garden and puts forth large branches, so that the OF HASHOMAYIM can nest under its shade.
And with many such meshalim, Rebbe, Melech HaMoshich was speaking to them the dvar Hashem as they were able to hear.

But apart from meshalim, Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach was not speaking to them.  Only privately, in a yechidus, was Rebbe Melech HaMoshiach explaining everything to his own talmidim.        REBBE, MELECH HAMOSHIACH THE BAAL MOFET
And on that day, when erev had come, Rebbe Melech HaMoshiach says to them, Let us go over to the other side of the lake.
And leaving the multitude, they took Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach, just as he was, in the sirah
And there arose a fierce gale of wind and the waves were beating against the sirah
And Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach was in the stern on the cushion sleeping, and they woke him up, and they say to him, Rebbe, does it not matter to you that we are perishing?
And having been awakened, Rebbe Melech HaMoshiach rebuked the wind, and he spoke to the lake, Sha!  Be still!  And there was a great calm.
And Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach said to them, Why do you have   morech lev
And they were afraid with a terrible pachad
And they came to the other side of the lake, to the country of the Gerasenes.
And as soon as Rebbe Melech HaMoshiach stepped out of the sirah
This man had
because often he had been bound with shackles and a kaval and the shackles and the kaval had been torn apart by him, and no one had the ko'ach to subdue him.
And constantly, yomam valailah, among the kevarim and in the mountains, he was crying out and beating himself with stones.
And, having seen Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach from afar, he ran and fell down before him.
And having cried out with a kol gadol, he says, Mah lanu valach, Yehoshua, Ben HaElohim HaElyon?  I implore you by Hashem, [do] not torment me.
For Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach had been saying to him, Come out of the man, ruach temei'ah!
And Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach was questioning him, saying, What is your name? And he says to him, `Legion' [is] my name, for we are many!
And he begged Rebbe Melech HaMoshiach again and again not to exorcise him and banish him from that place.
Now there was a large herd of chazirim feeding nearby on the hillside.
And they

And he permitted them.  And having come out, the ruchot hatemei'ot entered into the chazirim.  And the herd of chazirim rushed down the slope into the lake, and there were about two thousand of them, and they were drowned in the lake. [Michoh 7:19]
And the herdsmen feeding them fled and reported it in the village and in the sadot
And they come to Yehoshua and they see the one that had been possessed by the shed sitting, clothed and in his right mind -- the very one having had the Legion!  And they were afraid.
And the edat re'iyah
Then they began to implore Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach to depart from their region.
And as Rebbe Melech HaMoshiach was stepping into the sirah
And Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach did not permit him, but says to him, Go home to your people and report to them everything that Hashem has done for you and [that] he had rachmanim

And the man left and began to preach in the Decapolis everything that Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach had done for him, and everyone was amazed.  REBBE, MELECH HAMOSHIACH'S TZITZIT AND TAHARAT HAMISHPOCHAH: EMUNAH AS THE MEANS OF BRINGING WOMEN BACK FROM THE STATE OF ESCHATOLOGICAL NIDDAH
And when Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach had crossed over again in the sirah
And one of the Roshei Beit HaKnesset comes -- Ya'ir was his name -- and, having seen Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach, he falls down at his feet,
and he begs him earnestly saying, Biti
And Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach went with Ya'ir. And a large multitude were following him and they were pressing against Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach.
And [there was] an isha having a flow of dahm shteym esreh shanah. [Vayikra 15:25-30]
And having suffered much by many rofim
And having heard about Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach, she came up  behind him in the multitude, and touched his garment.
For she was saying, If I may touch even the garments of Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach, I will receive refu'ah.
And ofen ort
And ofen ort
And the talmidim of Rebbe Melech HaMoshiach were saying to him, You see the multitude pressing against you, and you say, `Who touched me?'
And Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach was looking around to see the one having done this.
Now the isha, B'YIR'AH
And Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach said to her, Bat, your emunah has brought you refu'ah.  Go in shalom and receive refu'ah from  your affliction.
While Rebbe Malech HaMoshiach was still speaking, some came from the Rosh Beit HaKnesset, saying, Your yaldah is niftar, are you still causing a shter
But Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach, having overheard what was being spoken, says to the Rosh Beit HaKnesset, Do not be afraid, only have emunah.
And Rebbe Melech HaMoshiach did not permit anyone to follow after him, except Kefa and Ya'akov and Yochanan, the brother of Ya'akov.
And they come into the bais of the Rosh Beit HaKnesset, and Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach beheld much commotion and weeping and loud wailing.
And having entered, Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach says to them, Why are you distressed and weeping?  The yaldah is not niftar but is only sleeping.
And they began making leitzonus of him.  But having put everyone out, Rebbe Melech HaMoshiach takes the abba of the na'arah and the immah and the ones with him, and goes into where the na'arah was.
And having grasped the hand of the na'arah, Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach says to her, Talitha Koum, which, being translated, means Little girl, to you I say, arise!
And ofen ort
And he gave orders to them earnestly that no one should have da'as of this.  And Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach said to give her some okhel.
And Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach came out from there and comes into his shtetl and his talmidim follow him.

And Shabbos having come, Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach began to say shiurim in the shul, and many, listening, were amazed, saying, From where [did] this one get lernen, and what [is] the chochmah that has been given to this one?  And what gevurot are being done by his hands?
Is not this one the Naggar
And Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach was saying to them, A navi is not without his kavod, except in his own shtetl and among his own mishpochah and in his own bais.
And he was not able there to do many nissim, except on a few cholim he laid
And he wondered on account of their lack of emunah. And he was going around the shtetlach in a circuit, saying shiurim.
And Rebbe Melech HaMoshiach summons the Shneym Asar, and he began to send them out two by two, and he was giving to them samchut [over] the ruchot hatume'ot
And Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach gave mitzot to them that they should take nothing on [the] derech except a mere walking stick -- not lechem, not a beggar's sack, nor a money belt;
but instead, to wear sandals, and not to take an extra kaftan.
And he was saying to them, Wherever you enter into a bais, stay there until you leave that area.
And whatever place does not give you the kabbalat panim, and does not listen to you, then, as you are leaving there, let it be NI'ER CHATZNO, shake off the dust of your feet, for an edut to them.
And having gone out, they preached that bnei Adam should teshuva.
And many shedim they were casting out, and they were anointing with shemen

And Herod the king heard of it, for the name of Yehoshua had become famous, and some were saying, Yochanan of the tevilah of teshuva has been made to stand up alive from [the] mesim, and for this reason the nissim
But others were saying, It is Eliyahu.  And still others were saying, He is a navi, like one of the nevi'im of old. [Malachi 4:5]
But when Herod heard of it, he kept saying, Yochanan whom I beheaded has stood up alive from the mesim!
For Herod himself had sent and had Yochanan arrested and bound in the beis hasohar, on account of Herodias, the wife of his brother, Philippos, for he had married her.
But Yochanan was saying to Herod, It is not mutar
And Herodias bore a grudge against Yochanan and desired to kill him. But she could not.

For Herod feared Yochanan, knowing him [to be] a tzaddik and kadosh, and Herod was protecting Yochanan. And when Herod heard    Yochanan, he was greatly disturbed, and [yet] gladly Herod was listening to Yochanan.
And, an opportune day having come, when Herod, on his birthday, gave a seudah for the court of his nobles, and the military commanders, and those of chashivut
And when his daughter entered and danced, she pleased Herod and the ones reclining at the seudah with him.  And the king said to the the girl, Ask me whatever you wish and I will give [it] to you.
And he made an shevu'ah
And having gone out, she said to her mother, What should I ask [for]?  And her mother said, The rosh Yochanan of the tevilah of teshuva.
And having entered, ofen ort
And having become very sad, the king, on account of his shevu'ah and on account of the ones reclining at the seudah [with him], was unwilling to refuse her.
And, ofen ort
And he brought the rosh Yochanan upon a platter and gave it to the young girl, and the young girl gave it to her mother.

And, having heard this, Yochanan's talmidim came and carried away his geviyah and placed it in a kever.     REBBE MELECH HAMOSHIACH'S TISH IN THE MIDBAR AND THE MANNA FROM SHOMAYIM SERVED AT HIS FARBRENGEN
And the Shluchim gathered together with Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach and reported to him everything which they did and which they had taught.

And Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach says to them, Come away a while, you yourselves, for a yechidus in a quiet place for a Shabbaton.  For there were many coming and going, and they did not even have time for okhel.
And they departed in the sirah
And the people, recognizing them, saw them departing, and from all the shtetlach they ran there and arrived ahead of them.
And having gotten out of the sirah
And when it was already a late hour, his talmidim came up to Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach and were saying, This place is desolate and already [it is] late.
Send them away, in order that, having departed to the surrounding farms and shtetlach, they may buy for themselves what okhel they may eat.

But in reply, Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach said to them, You yourselves give them [something] to eat.  And they say to him, Shall we go and spend two hundred denarii for lechem and give to them to eat? [Melachim Bais 4:42-44]
And Rebbe, Melech Hamoshiach says to them, How much lechem do you have?  Go [and] see. And knowing, the talmidim of Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach say, Chamesh, and dagim, shenayim.
And Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach commanded them to recline at tish, as it were, everyone group by group, on the green grass.
And they reclined, group by group, in hundreds and in fifties.

And, having taken the chamesh loaves and the shnei hadagim and looking up to Shomayim, Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach said a berakhah, and having offered the betzi'at halechem, Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach was giving to his talmidim in order that they might set them before the people.  And Rebbe Melech HaMoshiach divided the shnei hadagim among them all.
And everyone ate, and they were satisfied,
And they picked up shirayim, shneym asar baskets full, and from the dagim.
And those who had eaten the loaves numbered chamesh elafim.  REBBE, MELECH HAMOSHIACH THE BAAL MOFET
And ofen ort
And having said a Shalom farewell to them, Rebbe Melech HaMoshiach departed to the mountain to daven.
And erev having come, the sirah
And having seen them laboring at the oars, for the wind was against them, about the fourth watch of halailah, Moshiach comes to them, walking on the lake. And he wanted to go by them.
But having seen him on the lake, they thought that it is a ruach refa'im.  And they cried out;
for everyone saw him.  And ofen ort
And he got into the sirah
For they did not understand concerning the loaves [6:43], but their levavot had been hardened.
And having crossed over onto the land, they came to Gennesaret and anchored [there].
And when they disembark from the sirah
And the people rushed everywhere in that whole region, and they began to carry about on their mats the cholim to where they heard he was.

And wherever Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach was entering into the shtetlach or into towns or into the countryside, thy laid the cholim in the marketplaces, entreating him that they might just touch the tzitzit of Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach.  And as many as touched it were receiving refu'ah. [Bamidbar 15:38-41; Devarim 22:12]
And, when they had come down from Yerushalayim, the Perushim and some of the Sofrim come together around Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach,
and they had observed that some of his talmidim were eating their lechem with yadayim temei'ot, that is, unwashed hands.
[For the Perushim, and indeed this was the Jewish minhag, do not eat without doing n'tilat yadayim and also observing the Masoret HaZekenim [the Torah Sheb'al peh].

And when they come from [the] marketplace, unless they do so, they do not eat.  And there are many other things which they have received in order to observe, such as the tevilah of cups and pitchers and copperpots.]
And the Perushim and the Sofrim question Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach, Why do your talmidim not follow the halakhah according to the Masoret HaZekenim, but eat their lechem with yadaym temei'ot?

And Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach said to them, Yeshayah rightly gave nevu'ah of you tzevu'im, as it has been written, HAAM HAZEH BISFATAV KIBDUNI V'LIBO RIKHAK MIMENI VATEHI YIRATAM OTI MITZVAT ANASHIM MELUMMADAH (This people with [their] lips honor me, but their heart is removed far away from me.
And in vain do they worship me, teaching as doctrines the mitzvot of men.) [Yeshayah 29:13]
Abandoning the mitzvat Hashem, you are holding to the Masoret HaBnei Adam.
And Rebbe Melech HaMoshiach was saying to them, You have a fine knack for setting aside the mitzvat Hashem in order that your own masorah might stand undisturbed.
For Moshe [Rabbeinu] said, `KABED ES AVICHA V'ES IMMECHA'
But you say, `If a man says to his Av or to his Em, whatever by me you might have benefited is Korban' [that is, the taitsh
then no longer do you permit him to do anything for his Av  or his Em.
You nullify and make void the dvar Hashem by means of your masorah you received. And you do many similar things.
And having summoned again the multitude, Rebbe Melech HaMoshiach was saying to them, Give ear to me and have binah.
There is nothing outside of a ben Adam
missing fehlt/missing
And when he left the multitude and entered a bais, Rebbe Melech HaMoshiach's talmidim were asking him [about] the mashal.
And he says to them, Are you so lacking in binah also? Do you not have binah that it is not what is outside and entering into the ben Adam that is able to make him tameh?
Because it does not enter into his lev, but into his stomach and goes out into the latrine, making all the okhel tohar.
And Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach was saying, It is the thing proceeding out of the ben Adam that makes him tameh.
For from within the lev of the ben Adam comes evil cravings and makhshavot: then zenunim
ni'ufim
All these evil things proceed from within and make the ben Adam tameh.   THE EMUNAH OF THE GOYIM IN SPITE OF THE MECHITZAH OF GENDER AND NATIONALITY SEPARATING THEM FROM REBBE, MELECH HAMOSHIACH
And from there Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach arose and departed to the district of Tzor and Tzidon. And having entered into a bais he wanted no one to have da'as, [yet] he was not able to escape notice.
But, after hearing about Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach, ofen ort
Now the woman was a Yevanit
And he was saying to her, Rishonah allow the banim to be satisfied, for it is not tov to take the lechem of the yeladim and throw it to kelevim.
But she replied, saying, Ken, Adoni, but even the kelevim under the shulchan eat from the crumbs of the yeladim.
And Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach said to her, Because of this teshuva
And having departed to her bais, she found the yaldah lying on the bed, the shed having gone out. REBBE, MELECH HAMOSHIACH DEPARTS TO LAKE KINNERET
When he returned from the region of Tzor, and then went through Tzidon to Lake Kinneret within the region of the Decapolis,

At the time of Herod king of Yehudah, there was an a certain kohen by the name Zecharyah, who belonged to the Aviyah division.  His isha was of the banot Aharon and her name was Elisheva. [Divrey Hayamim Alef 24:10]
