And now, yeladim, remain in him, that when he is hitgalut we may have bittachon and not have bushah
If you have da'as that he is tzaddik, you have da'as that also everyone who is a po'el tzedek
See what kind of ahavah HaAv has given to us, that yeladim of Elohim we should be called. And we are. Therefore, the Olam Hazeh  does not have da'as of us, because it did not have da'as of him.

Chaverim, now yeladim of Elohim we are, and not yet it has been hitgalut what we will be.  We have da'as that when he is hitgalut, like him we will be, because we will see him as he is. [Tehillim 17:15]
And everyone having this tikvah
Everyone practicing chet also does averah, and chet is averah.
And you have da'as that that One has been made hitgalut that the averos he might take away [Yeshayah 53:4-12], and chet in him is not. [Yeshayah 53:9]
Everyone in him making his maon does not go on sinning; everyone sinning has not seen him nor has had da'as of him.
Yeladim, let no [navi sheker, I Yochanan 4:1] deceive you; the one practicing tzedek is tzodek, even as that One is tzaddik.
The one practicing averos is of Hasatan, because from the beginning Hasatan sins. For this tachlis was made hitgalut the Ben HaElohim, that he might destroy the pe'ulot Hasatan.
Everyone having been born of Hashem is not practicing chet, because his Zera makes maon in him, and he cannot abide sinning, because he is born of Hashem. [Tehillim 119:3]

By this is made hitgalut the yeladim of Hashem and the yeladim of Hasatan; everyone not practicing tzedek is not of Hashem; also the one not having ahavah for his Ach b'Moshiach. HAVE AHAVAH FOR ONE ANOTHER
Because this is the divrei Torah which we heard from the Reshit, that we have ahavah one for another,

not as Kayin, who was of the evil one, and slaughtered the ach of him; and for what cause did he slaughter him?  Because the ma'asim of him were ra'im and the ma'asim of the ach of him were tzedek. [Bereshis 4:8; Tehillim 38:20; Mishle 29:10]
And, Achim b'Moshiach, do not marvel if the Olam Hazeh hates you.
We have da'as that we have passed out of mavet into Chayyim, because we have ahavah for the Achim b'Moshiach; the one not having ahavah makes his ma'on in death.
Everyone hating his Ach b'Moshiach is a rotzeiach
By this we have had da'as of ahavah, because that One on behalf of us laid down his neshamah; and we ought, on behalf of the Achim b'Moshiach, to lay down our neshamot.
Now whoever has vital possessions of the Olam Hazeh and sees the Ach b'Moshiach of him being nitzrach
Yeladim, let us not have ahavah in dvar or in lashon  but in ma'aseh and in Emes.[Yechezkel 33:31]
And by this we will have da'as that we are of HaEmes, and before him we will persuade our levavot,
that if our levavot condemn us, Hashem is greater than our levavot, and he has da'as of all things.
Chaverim, if our levavot do not bring us under the gezar din
And whatever we request, we receive from him, because we are shomer of his mitzvot and the things pleasing before him we practice.
And this is the mitzvah of him, that we have emunah b'Shem of the Ben HaElohim of him, Yehoshua, Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach, and that we have ahavah one for another, as he gave mitzvah to us.
And the one being shomer of his mitzvot makes his ma'on in him and he makes his ma'on in him; and by this we have da'as that he abides in us, by the Ruach Hakodesh whom he gave to us.
Chaverim, do not believe every ruach. [Yirmeyah 29:8] But test the ruchot
By this we have da'as of the Ruach Hakodesh of Hashem: every ruach which makes hoda'ah
and every ruach which does not make hoda'ah of Yehoshua is not of Hashem.  And this is the ruach of the Anti-Moshiach, which you have heard that it is coming; and now it already is in the Olam Hazeh.
Yeladim, you are of Hashem, and you have overcome them, because greater is the One in you than the one in the Olam Hazeh. [Melachim Bais 6:16]
They are of the Olam Hazeh; therefore, of the Olam Hazeh they speak, and the Olam Hazeh pays heed to them.

We are of Hashem; the one having da'as of Hashem pays heed to us; he who is not of Hashem does not pay heed to us.  From this we have da'as of the Ruach Hakodesh of Emes and the ruach of deceiving toyus
Chaverim, let us have ahavah one for another, because ahavah is of Hashem, and everyone having ahavah has been born of Hashem and has da'as of Hashem.
The one not having ahavah did not have da'as of Hashem, because Hashem is ahavah.
By this was made hitgalut the ahavah of Hashem among us, because Hashem has sent his Ben Yachid into the Olam Hazeh that we may live through him.
In this is ahavah, not that we have had ahavah for Hashem, but that Hashem had ahavah for us and gave his Ben HaElohim as a kapparah for chattoteynu.
Chaverim, if Hashem so had ahavah for us, also we ought to have ahavah one for another.
No one has ever beheld Hashem.  If we have ahavah one for another, G-d makes his ma'on in us and the Ahavas Hashem in us has been made shleimah.
By this we have da'as that we have our ma'on in him and he in us, because of the Ruach Hakodesh of him he has given us.
And we have beheld and we give solemn edut
Whoever makes hoda'ah
And we have had da'as and have had emunah in the ahavah which Hashem has for us. Hashem is ahavah.  The one making his ma'on in ahavah makes his ma'on in Hashem and Hashem in him.
By this has the ahavah become shleimah with us, that we may have ittachon in the Yom HaMishpat, because as that One is, so we are also in the Olam Hazeh.
Pachad
We have ahavah because he first had ahavah for us.
If anyone says I have ahavah for Hashem and the Ach b'Moshiach he hates, he is a shakkeran
And this mitzvah we have from him that the one having ahavah for Hashem should have ahavah also for the Ach b'Moshiach of him.

Everyone with emunah that Yehoshua is the Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach has been born of Hashem, and everyone having ahavah for the One having given birth has also ahavah for the one having been born of him.
By this we have da'as that we have ahavah for the yeladim of Hashem, when we have ahavas Hashem and we are shomer of His mitzvot.
For this is the ahavas Hashem, that we are shomer of His mitzvot, and His mitzvot are not burdensome. [Devarim 30:11]
Because all that has been born of Hashem obtains nitzachon
And who is the one overcoming the Olam Hazeh except the one with emunah that Yehoshua is the Ben HaElohim? THE SOLEMN EDUT OF REBBE, MELECH HAMOSHIACH'S SHLUCHIM CONCERNING THE BEN HAELOHIM
This One is the One having come by mayim and dahm, Yehoshua, Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach, not by the mayim only but by the mayim and by the dahm; and the Ruach Hakodesh is the one giving solemn edut
Because there are shloshah giving solemn edut:
the Ruach Hakodesh and the mayim and the dahm, and the shloshah are for solemn edut.
If the solemn edut of bnei Adam we receive, the solemn edut of Hashem is greater, because this is the edut of Hashem that he has testified concerning the Ben HaElohim of him.
The one with emunah in the Ben HaElohim has the edut even the eidus
And this is the edut, that Hashem gave Chayyei Olam to us, and this Chayyim is in HaBen of him.
The one having HaBen has the Chayyim; the one not having HaBen HaElohim does not have Chayyim.  THE DA'AS OF CHAYYEI OLAM
These things I wrote to you who have emunah b'shem Ha Ben Ha Elohim, that you vada may have da'as that you have Chayyei Olam. [Yochanan 20:31]
And this is the bittachon which we have with him, that if we request anything according to the ratzon Hashem, he hears us.
And if we have da'as that he hears us, whatever we ask,  we have da'as that we have the requests which we asked from him. [Melachim Alef 3:12]

If anyone sees his Ach b'Moshiach sinning an averah not leading to mavet, he will ask and Hashem will give to him Chayyim, to the ones sinning a chet not leading to mavet.  There is an averah leading to mavet.  I do not say we should make request concerning that averah. [Shemot 23:21; Yirmeyah 7:16; 14:11]
Kol avon is chet, and there is chet not leading to mavet.
We have da'as that everyone having been born of Hashem does not continually sin, but the One having been born of G-d
We have da'as that we are of Hashem and the whole Olam Hazeh lies under Hasatan.

And we have da'as that the Ben HaElohim has come and has given us binah that we may have da'as of the One who is Omein, and we are in the One who is Omein, even in HaBen of him, Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach Yehoshua.  This one is the true G-d and Chayyei Olam [Yirmeyah 24:7].
Yeladim, keep yourselves from elilim [Yirmeyah 5:18-19].

I had many things to write to you, but I do not want to write to you with pen and ink.

Rachamim Hashem and Shalom Hashem and Ahavas Hashem to you abundantly!    THE ORTHODOX JEWISH FAITH AND THE TRUE GEULAH
Chaverim, although I was very eager to write to you concerning the Geulah
For certain men, anshei resha
Now I wish to remind you, though you are fully informed, that Hashem, who once saved a people from the land of Mitzrayim
And you know about the malachim
As S'dom and Amora and the cities around them, in a doime
Likewise, indeed, these [certain men, 1:4], these dreamers, on the one hand, pollute the basar
By contrast, Micha'el the Sar haMalachim
But, on the one hand, these [men] slander whatever they do not understand; on the other hand, what they do understand instinctively, like unreasoning animals, by these things they are destroyed.
Oy to them!  Because they walked in the Derech Kayin
These [men] are hidden reefs [moored at] your seudas
wild waves of the sea, foaming up their ma'asim hara'im
But also it was about these [men] that Enoch, in the seventh [generation] from Adam, prophesied, saying, Hinei!  Hashem comes with His ten thousands of malachim
for the purpose of bringing all to Mishpat and for the purpose of proving guilty every neshamah of all of its deeds done without yirat Shomayim and of all the harsh things chatta'im
These [men] are malcontents and faultfinders, walking according to their ta'avot
But you, Chaverim, keep in mind the predictions
because they were telling you that at Acharit haYamim
These [men] are the ones causing division, worldly men, not having the Ruach Hakodesh. BUILD YOURSELF UP ON THE KITVEI HAKODESH
But you, Chaverim, build yourselves up on your most holy,
Keep yourselves in the Ahavas Hashem, awaiting the rachamim of Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach Adoneinu Yehoshua unto Chayyei Olam.  HAVING RACHAMIM, BUT BEING MECHALEK
To those who are wavering, show rachamim; others, deliver, snatching them out of the Aish [Olam];
On others, have rachamim mixed with yirat Shomayim, hating even the undergarment defiled by corrupt human nature. BIRKAT HAPRIDAH
Now to the One who is able to stand shomer over you, to make you moineia
to haElohim Hayachid Moshieynu
The Gilluy Shechinah of Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach Yehoshua which Hashem gave to him to show to his mesharetim
Yochanan gave solemn edut

Yochanan to the sheva
And from Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach, the eidus hane'eman
and made us a Malchut, a Mamlekhet kohanim [Shemot 19:6], kohanim doing avodas kodesh to his Elohim HaAv, lo hakavod v'hagevurah l'olmey olamim. Omein. [Shemot 19:6; 23:22; Yeshayah 61:6]
Hinei! Hu habah
Ani Hu the Alef and the Tav, says Hashem Adonoi, the One who is and the One who was and the One coming, Adonoi Tzvaot. [Shemot 3:14; Yeshayah 41:4; Amos 3:13; 4:13 Targum Ha-Shivim
I, Yochanan, your Ach b'Moshiach and your fellow partaker of the khelek
I was in the Ruach Hakodesh on Yom HaAdon and I heard behind me a great sound, like the blast of a shofar, [Yechezkel 3:12; Shemot 19:16]

saying, What you see [in the chazon], write in a sefer and send it to the sheva Kehillot, to Ephesus and to Smyrna and to Pergamum and to Thyatira and to Sardis and to Philadelphia and to Laodicea. [Yeshayah 30:8]
Then I turned to see the kol which was speaking with me, and, having turned, I saw sheva golden menorot. [Zecharyah 4:2; Shemot 25:31-40]
And in the midst of the menorot stood One like the Ben HaAdam [Daniel 7:13-14; Yechezkel 1:26], having been clothed in a kaftan
And the rosh of him and the hair were lavan
and the feet of him were like burnished bronze as if in a furnace having been made to glow, and the kol of him as the sound of mayim rabbim
And he had in the yad yamin of him shevat hakokhavim
And when I saw him, I fell at the feet of him as though dead, and he placed the yad yamin of him upon me saying, Do not fear; I am HaRishon
and HaChai

To the malach of the Kehillah
I have da'as of your ma'asim and your amal
And you have savlanut
But I have this against you, that you abandoned your Ahavah HaRishonah. [Yirmeyah 2:2]
Therefore, let there be zikaron
But this you have, that you loathe the ma'asim ra'im of the Nicolaitans, which also I loathe.[Tehillim 139:21]
The one having an ear let him hear what the Ruach Hakodesh says to the Kehillot. To the one who wins the nitzachon
And to the malach of the Kehillah in Smyrna, write: these things says HaRishon and HaAcharon, who became niftar and came back to Chayyim
I have da'as of your tzarah

Do not fear at all the things you are about to suffer. Hinei! Hasatan is about to cast some of you into beit hasohar that you may be tested and you will have tzarah aseret yamim. Be ne'eman ad haMavet
The one having ears let him hear what the Ruach Hakodesh says to the Kehillot. The one who wins the nitzachon
And to the malach of the Kehillah at Pergamum, write: these things says the one having the sharp two-edged cherev: [Yeshayah 49:2]
I have da'as of where you make your ma'on, where the kisseh of Hasatan is, and you hold fast ha-Shem of me and did not make hakhchashah
But I have a few things against you, because you have there ones holding to the torah of Bil`am, who was teaching Balak to put a michshol before Bnei Yisroel. [Bamidbar 31:16; 25:1-2]
So also you have ones eating okhel
Likewise, therefore, make teshuva
The one having an ear let him hear what the Ruach Hakodesh says to the Kehillot. To the one who wins the nitzachon
And to the malach of the Kehillah in Thyatira, write: these things says the Ben HaElohim, the One having his eynayim
I have da'as of your ma'asim and the ahavah and the emunah and the Tzedek [Daniel 9:25] and the savlanut
But I have this against you, that you are being permissive toward that isha Izevel
And I gave her time that she might make teshuva and she does not wish to make teshuva of her zenut. [Melachim Alef 16:31; Melachim Bais 9:22; Bamidbar 25:1-2]
Hinei!  I am throwing her into a bed, and the ones committing ni'uf
And her yeladim I will kill with Mavet, and all the kehillot will have da'as that I am the One searching their klayot valev
But I say to you, the rest, to the ones in Thyatira, as many as have not this torah, who did not have da'as of the, as they say, the tiefe
Al kol panim
And the one who wins the nitzachon
to rule them with a shevet barzel
even as I also have received from HaAv of me and I will give him the Kochav
The one having an ear let him hear what the Ruach Hakodesh says to the Kehillot.

And to the malach of the Kehillah in Sardis, write: these things says the One having the sheva ruchot of Hashem and the shevat hakokhavim: I have da'as of your ma'asim, that nominally you are Chai but you are niftar.
Be shomer and regarding the things remaining and the things on the point of mavet, be chazakim
Therefore, let there be zikaron
But you have a few shmot
The one who wins the nitzachon
The one having an ear let him hear what the Ruach Hakodesh says to the Kehillot.    THE IGGERET HAKODESH TO THE KEHILLAH AT PHILADELPHIA
And to the malach of the Kehillah in Philadelphia, write: these things says HaKadosh, HaAmiti, the One having the mafte'ach
I have da'as of your ma'asim.  Hinei! I have placed in front of you a delet
and did not make hakhchashah
Because you were shomer over my dvar of savlanut
I am coming quickly; hold fast to what you have, that no one takes the atarah of you.
The one who wins the nitzachon
The one having an ear let him hear what the Ruach Hakodesh says to the Kehillot.  THE IGGERET HAKODESH TO THE KEHILLAH AT LAODICEA
And to the malach of the Kehillah in Laodicea, write: these things says the Omein, the Eidus Hane'eman who is also HaEmes, [Mishle 8:22]
the Reshit of the Bri'at Hashem: I have da'as of your ma'asim, that you are neither kar
But because you are posher
Because you say, I am ashir
I counsel you to buy from me gold having been purified by aish
Those for whom I have ahavah I reprove and discipline.  Be kham
Hinei! I have stood at the delet
The one who wins the nitzachon
The one having an ear let him hear what the Ruach Hakodesh says to the Kehillot.
After these things I looked, and--hinei!--a delet
At once I was in the Ruach Hakodesh, and--hinei!-- there in Shomayim stood a kisseh, and upon the kisseh DEMUT KEMAREH ADAM
and the One sitting was like KEMAREH
And around the kisseh were esrim v'arba'ah kisot
And out of the kisseh comes forth lightning and sounds and thunders and there were sheva lapidei aish
And before the kisseh there was something like a sea of glass, like crystal.  And on each side and around the kisseh there were Arbah Chayyot
And HaRishonah of HaChayyot [Yechezkel 1:10; 1:14] was like an aryeh
and HaReve'it of HaChayyot was like a flying nesher
And whenever the Chayyot will give kavod

Then the esrim v'arba'ah Zekenim fall prostrate before the One sitting on the kisseh and worship the One that Hu Chai ad olemei olamim and cast down the atarot of them before the kisseh, saying, [Devarim 33:3]

And he says to me, write: ashrey are the ones having been summoned to the Yom Nisu'im seudah of the Seh.
And I fell before his feet to worship him. And he says to me, You must abstain from such. For I am a fellow eved with both you and your chaverim who hold on to the edut

And I saw Shomayim having been opened, and --hinei!-- A lavan sus and the one riding on it is called  ne'eman and Yashar,  and in Tzedek [Daniel 9:25] he judges and makes milkhamah.  [Shemot 15:3; Tehillim 96:13; Yeshayah 11:4]
And, the Eynayim of him are as a flame of aish, and on the head of him are many atarot, and he has a name inscribed of which no one has da'as except himself.
And he is robed in a kaftan dipped in dahm, and his Name is called HADVAR HASHEM. [Yeshayah 63:2,3]
And the TZIVA'OT HaShomayim were following him on susim levanim. They were dressed in fine linen, lavan
And out of the peh
And he has on his garment and on his thigh a name inscribed: Melech Hamelechim and Adon HaAdonim.
And I saw one malach having taken his stand in the shemesh
that you may eat the basar of melachim
And I saw the Chayyah [Anti-Moshiach] and the melachim

And the Chayyah [Anti-Moshiach] was captured and, with it, the navi sheker, the one having performed the otot before it, by which he deceived the ones having received the tav of the Chayyah [Anti-Moshiach] and the ones worshiping its Etzev. These two were cast alive into the Agam HaAish burning with gofrit
And the rest were killed with the cherev of the One sitting on the sus, the cherev having proceeded out of the PEH of him, and all the birds were fully fed by their basar.
And I saw a malach coming down out of Shomayim having the mafte'ach
and he seized the Dragon, the Nachash HaKadmoni, who is malshin [samekh mem, the devil] and Hasatan. And he bound him elef shanim,
and threw him into the Tehom
And I saw kisa'ot and they sat on them and mishpat
And the rest of the mesim did not awaken to Chayyim
Me'ushar and kadosh is the one having part in the Techiyah HaRishonah. On these ones the Mavet HaSheyni does not have shilton
And when haelef shanim would be completed, Hasatan will be released from his beit hasohar

and will go forth to deceive the goyim in the four corners of ha'aretz, that is, Gog and Magog, to assemble them for milkhamah. The mispar whose number is as the sand of seashore. [Yeshayah 11:12; Yechezkel 7:2; 38:2; 39:1; 38:9,15]
And they went up over the broad plain of the land and encircled the makhaneh
And Hasatan, the one deceiving them, was thrown into the agam haAish
And I saw a kisse lavan gadol

And I saw the mesim, the ketanim and gedolim, having taken their stand before the kisse and sfarim were opened and another Sefer was opened, which is the Sefer HaChayyim and the mesim were judged by the things having been written in the sfarim according to their ma'asim
And the Yam
And Mavet and She'ol were thrown into the Agam HaAish. This is the Mavet HaSheyni, the Agam HaAish.
And if anyone was not found having been written in the Sefer HaChayyim, he was cast into the Agam HaAish.
And I saw Shomayim Chadashim and Eretz Chadasha for the Shomayim HaRishonah and HaAretz HaChadasha passed away, and there is no longer an Yam.

And I saw the Ir Hakodesh, the Yerushalayim HaChadasha coming down and descending out of Shomayim from Hashem, having been made ready as a Kallah adorned for her Ba'al. [Nechemyah 11:18; Yeshayah 52:1]

And I heard a kol gadol, a Bat Kol from the kisse saying, hinei!--the mishkan of Hashem is with men, and he shall tabernacle with them, and they shall be his people, and He himself--Immanu-El--will be their G-d. [Shemot 25:8; Divrey Hayamim Bais 6:18; Yechezkel 48:35; Zecharyah 2:10]
And he will wipe away every tear from their eyes, and Mavet will be, nor agmat nefesh nor crying nor pain will be any longer; the former things have passed away. [Yeshayah 25:8; 35:10]
And said the One sitting on the kisseh, hinei!--I make all things chadash. And he says, Write, for these dvarim are ne'emanim and amittiyim.
And he said to me, It is finished! I am the Alef and the Tav, the Reshit and the Ketz. To the one thirsting I will give of the Mayan
The one who wins the nitzachon victory, shall inherit these things and I will be his G-d and he will be to me Beni.[Shmuel Bais 7:14]
But for those of morech lev
And one of the shevat hamalachim having the sheva ke'arot
And he carried me away in Ruach Hakodesh onto a great and high mountain, and showed me Ir Hakodesh, Yerushalayim descending and coming down out of Shomayim from G-d Hashem, [Yechezkel 40:2]
having the kavod
having a great and high wall, having Sheneym Asar shi'arim,  and at the shi'arim Sheneym Asar malachim, and Shemot
There were shloshah shi'arim on the mizrach
And the wall of the Ir Hakodesh had Sheneym Asar Foundation Stones, and on them were the Sheneym Asar shemot
And the one speaking with me had a gold measuring rod, that he might measure the Ir Hakodesh and its shi'arim and its wall. [Yechezkel 40:3]

And the city is laid out foursquare, shaped like a cube, and its length is as great as the width; and he measured the Ir Hakodesh with the rod across stadia Sheneym Asar thousand, the length and the breadth and the height are equal.
And he measured its wall a hundred forty-four cubits by man's measurement, which is also that of the malachim.
And the wall was constructed of jasper and the Ir was pure gold like clear glass.
The foundation stones of the wall of the city were adorned with every kind of precious stone, Harishon
Hachamishi, sardonyx, Hashishi, carnelian, Hash'vi'i, chrysolite, Hashemini, beryl, Hateshi'i, topaz, Haasiri chrysoprase, HaAchad Asar, jacinth, Hasheneym Asar, amethyst.
And the Sheneym Asar shi'arim were Sheneym Asar pearls, respectively each one of the shi'arim was a single pearl. And the reckov
And I saw no Heikhal in it, for Adonoi Hashem El Shaddai and the Seh
And the city has no need of the shemesh
And the Nations shall walk their derech by its Ohr
And the shi'arim of it shall never be shut b'yom for there will be no Lailah. [Yeshayah 60:11; Zecharyah 14:7]
And the melachim will bring the kavod
And never may enter into it any thing tameh and anyone practicing to'evah
And he showed me a nahar of water of Chayyim
In the middle of the rehkov
And there shall no longer be any kelalah, and the kisseh of  Hashem and of the Seh
And they will see his face, and ha-Shem of him will be on the mitzakhim
And there shall no longer be Lailah, and they have no need of the ohr
And he said to me, These dvarim are ne'emanim and amittiyim, and Hashem Elohei ruchot hanevi'im sent his malach to show to his avadim
And --hinei!--I am coming quickly. Ashrey is the one who is shomer, keeping the dvarim hanevu'ah of this sefer.
And I, Yochanan, am the one hearing and seeing these things. And when I heard and saw, I fell to worship before the feet of the malach showing me these things.
And he says to me, See that you do not do it; a fellow eved of yours I am, and of your Achim, the nevi'im
Worship Hashem! And he says to me, Do not seal up the dvarim hanevu'ah
Let the one being unrighteous, let him be unrighteous noch
Hinei!--I am coming quickly, and my sachar
I am the Alef and the Tav, HaRishon
Ashrey are the ones washing their kaftans, that they may have the right to the Aitz
Outside are the kelevim
I, Rebbe, Melech HaMoshiach Yehoshua sent my malach to give solemn edut
And the Ruach Hakodesh and the Kallah say, Bo! And the one hearing let him say, Bo! And the one thirsting, let him come, the one desiring let him take the mayim haChayyim freely.
I give solemn edut to everyone hearing the divrei haNevu'ah of this sefer: if anyone adds to them Hashem will add to him the makkot
and if anyone takes away from the dvarim of the sefer of this nevu'ah
He who gives solemn edut to these things says, Ken! I am coming bahlt
The Chen v'Chesed Hashem of the Adoneinu Yehoshua be with all.     Entire Brit Chadasha Translation finished 4/10/94 to 11/14/96 To Moshiach be the  Glory
